1313.content:
Rebecca walked slowly around the portal, a faint hum, and a tinge of ozone filled the air. Stopping as she reached the cables snaking back to the computer, she'd admired her work from every angle. The arch in the centre looked like any other doorframe, if a little too modern with electronics plastered to it in places.

A faint glow was visible within, that was slightly grey-green when she looked through. Her work on high-energy physics had a minor interaction at the low end of the energy scale. She had created a link between this world and another.

Lips rather too dry, she tried to moisten them. Rebecca's mouth was as parched as her lips, and she took a swallow from the bottle she was nervously tapping against her thigh. There was only one way to test it, and only one person here to test it.

15.title: Link to the original

info.brief_description: One day, someone invents a device that can transform people!  (original by Kafoll)
info.description:
I've been wanting to read this German interactive for a while, and I finally realized how I might be able to: Translate it myself!
I've taken great liberties to keep this translation as close to the original as possible, while also correcting inconsistencies in the translation process (German apparently translates into English extremely poorly...).
I will include a link to the original here and within the Interactive. Please tell me if you like what I'm doing.
In an effort to stay true to the original, I would highly appreciate it if you held back from adding to this. I know, this is a highly unusual request, but just bear with me. I would, however, like it if you notify me of mistakes I may have missed. In the process of translation, grammer breaks the world, and there is no way I can catch everything myself.

Expect this project of mine to take several weeks to complete.

http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1937362-Das-Verwandlungsger

I mean Kafoll no offense by effectively ripping off his Interactive - I am simply attempting to bring it to a wider audience.
Credit to the original authors of each chapter will be added at a later date.
